intro: Bossiaea heterophylla, commonly known as the variable bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves that vary in shape and size. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in heathlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
